partners.title: Partners
partners.intro: Meet our network of dedicated partners working together to make a difference.

een.about: The European Employment Network (EEN) is a leading organization dedicated to promoting inclusive employment practices across Europe. With over 20 years of experience, EEN has been at the forefront of developing innovative approaches to supported employment and workplace inclusion.
een.mission: Our mission is to create a more inclusive European labor market by facilitating knowledge exchange, developing best practices, and coordinating transnational projects that promote employment opportunities for people with disabilities and other disadvantaged groups.
een.contribution: As the Project Coordinator, EEN leads the overall management and coordination of the BE AWARE project, ensuring effective collaboration among all partners and successful delivery of project objectives.
een.activity3: Quality assurance and monitoring of project deliverables
een.address: Rue de la Loi 123, 1040 Brussels, Belgium

iwf.about: The Inclusive Work Foundation (IWF) is a Portuguese non-profit organization specializing in vocational training and employment support for people with disabilities. Founded in 2010, IWF has successfully supported over 2,000 individuals in finding and maintaining meaningful employment.
iwf.mission: IWF's mission is to empower individuals with disabilities through comprehensive training programs, job coaching, and employer engagement initiatives that foster inclusive workplaces and sustainable employment outcomes.
iwf.contribution: As the Training Partner, IWF develops and delivers innovative training programs for employment support professionals, focusing on evidence-based practices and person-centered approaches to supported employment.
iwf.activity1: Development of training curricula and materials
iwf.activity2: Delivery of workshops and capacity-building sessions
iwf.activity3: Creation of online learning resources and toolkits

csi.about: The Centre for Social Innovation (CSI) is a French research institute dedicated to studying and promoting social innovation in employment, education, and community development. CSI combines academic rigor with practical application to drive meaningful social change.
csi.mission: CSI's mission is to advance knowledge and practice in social innovation through rigorous research, evidence-based policy recommendations, and collaborative partnerships that address complex social challenges in the labor market.
csi.contribution: As the Research Partner, CSI conducts comprehensive research on supported employment practices, labor market trends, and policy frameworks, providing the evidence base that informs project activities and outputs.
csi.activity1: Conducting research studies and data analysis

asl.about: Accessibility Solutions Ltd (ASL) is a German technology company specializing in assistive technologies and digital accessibility solutions for the workplace. ASL has been a pioneer in developing innovative tools that enable people with disabilities to participate fully in the digital economy.
asl.mission: ASL's mission is to eliminate digital barriers in the workplace through cutting-edge assistive technologies, accessibility consulting, and user-centered design approaches that create truly inclusive digital environments.
asl.contribution: As the Technology Partner, ASL provides technical expertise in digital accessibility, develops online platforms and tools for the project, and ensures all digital resources meet the highest accessibility standards.
asl.activity1: Development of accessible digital platforms and tools
asl.activity3: Technical training and support for partners
